data.question: What is the highest coordination number known for europium in the context of the discussed metal-organic frameworks?
Which ligand was used to achieve multidimensional connectivity in the synthesis of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
What are the coordination numbers and the corresponding Eu-N distances for the different europium sites in 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: CN = 8 (Eu2) with distances 258(2)–284(2) pm, CN = 9 (Eu1) with distances 263(1)–294(2) pm, and CN = 12 (Eu3) with distances 296(1)–311(1) pm

data.question: What was the role of mercury in the synthesis of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: Mercury was used for the activation of the europium metal.

data.question: How does the coordination environment of Eu3 in 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] compare to previously reported coordination polymers?
data.answer: The coordination environment of Eu3 in 1[Eu(Tzpy)2], being an undistorted icosahedron, has not previously been reported for coordination polymers and frameworks.

data.question: What was the yield of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] in the synthesis described?
Considering the synthesis conditions, what would likely happen if the reaction temperature exceeds 208°C?
data.answer: Any slight overheating results in decomposition of the ligand.

data.question: Why is the solvothermal synthesis in pyridine considered more favorable for producing 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: The solvothermal synthesis in pyridine is more favorable because it avoids the decomposition of the ligand and produces large amounts of transparent orange crystals, whereas without pyridine, 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] is only obtained as a powder.

data.question: How does the introduction of an additional nitrogen atom into the benzotriazole ligand affect the synthesis of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: The introduction of an additional nitrogen atom into the benzotriazole ligand enables 1,3-chelate bonding, which allows multidimensional connectivity.

data.question: What is the significance of the icosahedral coordination environment in 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: The icosahedral coordination environment results in an unprecedented complexity in the topology of a lanthanide coordination polymer.

data.question: How does the coordination number of europium in 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] compare to that in other known rare-earth amides?
data.answer: The coordination number of 12 for europium in 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] is higher than the coordination numbers of six for LnIII and eight for EuII in other known rare-earth amides.

data.question: What does the presence of EuIII signals in the 151Eu MDßbauer spectroscopy indicate about 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: The presence of EuIII signals could indicate mixed valency in the compound or partial decomposition or hydrolysis due to the air and moisture sensitivity of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2].

data.question: What is the impact of the large rhombohedral unit cell with an extraordinarily long c axis on the structure of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2]?
data.answer: The large rhombohedral unit cell with an extraordinarily long c axis contributes to the unique connectivity and structural complexity of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2].

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] marks the first report of an icosahedral coordination environment in coordination polymers.
True or False: The synthesis of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] without pyridine results in the same yield and crystal quality as with pyridine.
True or False: All europium sites in 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] contain EuIII.
True or False: The coordination number of europium in 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] is unprecedented for europium-based coordination polymers.
True or False: The synthesis of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] did not require any special conditions such as degassing or sealing under vacuum.
True or False: The Eu-N distances in the icosahedron of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] are significantly shorter than those in other known europium amides.
True or False: The synthesis of 1[Eu(Tzpy)2] represents a transition from the chemistry of triazoles to the high-temperature chemistry of N4 ligands.
